msContents.summary:
An incomplete Nepalese manuscript of the Cāndravyākaraṇapañjikā of Ratnamati , an unpublished commentary on the Cāndravyākaraṇa of the Buddhist grammarian Candragomin (probably 5th c. CE) and the Vṛtti attributed to Dharmadāsa . The work has been identified with the help of Dragomir Dimitrov (Marburg) and Mahesh Deokar (Pune). The former is preparing the editio princeps of the Pañjikā on the basis of one incomplete manuscript kept in the Kaiser Library in Kathmandu (Dimitrov 2010a: 25-26). According to Dimitrov (2010b: 41-44; 2014: 595-700), the grammarian Ratnamati is the same as Ratnaśrījñāna, a Sinhalese Buddhist monk who composed a commentary on Daṇḍin 's Kāvyādarśa in the first half of the 10th c. CE, and who also wrote works in Sinhalese and Pāli under the name of Upatissa. The manuscript contains the commentary on section 2 (pāda, literally “quarter”) of chapter 2 (adhyāya) of Candragomin's grammar. It appears to comment on most but not all rules, which are given in abbreviated form. For example, on f. 2v2, to the right of the string hole, the term asaṃ is a reference to sūtra 2.2.2, asaṃkhyaṃ
vibhaktisamīpābhāvakhyātipaścādyathāyugapatsampatsākalyārthe
vibhaktisamīpābhāvakhyāti-paścādyathāyugapatsampatsākalyārthe
. One or more folios are missing at the end. The text stops in the middle of the commentary on the last rule of the section, namely 2.2.87, lug anādiluky agoṇyādīnām, on f. 71v5.

msItem.title: Cāndravyākaraṇapañjikā
msItem.incipit: [1r1] supā | supaiti prathamaikavacanaṃm ārabhya saptamībahuvacanapakāreṇa pratyāhāragrahaṇaṃ vidhigrahaṇanyāyena tadantagrahaṇam ity āha subantam ityādi [1r2] sāmānyoktā vidhi yasya yena sambandhas tena saha % tad ekārtham bhavatīti sambandhād vijñāyate | tad yathā mātari varṇitavyaṃ pitari śuśrūṣitavya [1r3]m iti na cocyate svasyāṃ svasminn ity atha ca yā ya¦%sya mātā yaś ca yasya piteti sambandhāt pratīyate | tadvad ihāpi | tenāniṣṭaṃ na kiñcid ihā [1r4] padyate ata eva vyapekṣāsāmarthyaparigrahā¦%ya samarthavacanaṃ nāśritaṃ ekārthībhāvas tv ekārthavacanenaiva saṅgṛhītaḥ tenātra vṛttāv ekārthī [1r5]bhāva eva na vākye vyapekṣābhedādilakṣaṇe | tathā % hi rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ iti rājā svāmy annṛcāt_ bhedakaḥ puruṣaḥ svān narāt_ || iti bhedaḥ saṃ [1r6]sargno trārthagṛhīto na hi vyāvṛttasya sambandhyantareṇāsambaddhasya svāder avasthānam asti | yadā rājā mamāyam ity apekṣate puruṣo ham -3- -4- [1v1]rgāvyāvṛttir arthagṛhītā na hy avyāvarttamānayoḥ || sambandhyantarebhyaḥ saṃsargad upapadyate || yadā tūbhayam api prādhānyenocyate tadobhayabhedasaṃsargī vā¦ [1v2]kyārthaḥ | ekārthībhāvasya samāsavyapadeśa i%ṣyate |
msItem.explicit: [71r5] || svasura iti tadapatyodvahanasambandhanimitto vyapadeśaḥ śva [71v1] sury asāv astīti trīpuṃbhedāvivakṣāyām ubhayor ekenābhidhānaṃ gatārthatvān noktaṃ | napuṃsakaliṅgasyānapuṃsakaliṅgena saha vacane napuṃsakenā[71v2]napuṃsasyāpy abhidhānañ caikavad iṣṭan tad api % nyāyataḥ pratipādayann āha || napuṃsakasyetyādi || napuṃsakaṃ sarvvaliṅgasāmānyarū¦[71v3]paṃ || tathā hi kiñ jātam iti napuṃsakena¦% lokaḥ pṛchati dvayaṃ caiva hi jāyate | strī vā puruṣo vātha caivaṃ prasnayati tato vagamya¦[71v4]te napuṃsakaṃ sādharaṇaṃ sarvveṣām imi bheda%vivakṣāyāṃ tena sarvveṣām abhidhānaṃ bahutvena abhedavivakṣāyāṃ ekatveneti prayoga¦[71v5] bheda upapannaḥ || tyadādīnāṃ sarvvaiḥ śabdaiḥ saha vacane tyadādibhir ekadhānyeṣām apy abhidhānam iṣṭaṃ tad api nyāyata eva siddham ity āha | tyadādī¦

supportDesc.foliation: Letter numerals, mid-left margin, verso. Number 1 on f. 1v is written with the letter a under the auspicious syllable śrī; number 10 is written with long ā; numbers 20, 30, 40, 50 and 70 (f. 60 is missing) are written with a syllable for the tens and a small circle for zero.
Nepālākṣara numerals, bottom right margin, verso.
supportDesc.condition: Incomplete (ff. 16, 21, 24-26, 28, 29, 33-36, 41, 59, 60, 66, 68 and from 72 onwards are missing). In good condition but brittle; strips of paper have been glued to the edges of some folios in order to protect and reinforce them, occasionally covering the text underneath. Some folios are faded, stained or smudged, but generally still legible.

layout.p: 5 to 6 lines per page, approximately 52 akṣaras per line.
layout.stringHole:
One string hole, in the left part of the folio, approximately in the middle of a square blank space.
2.5 2.5
layout.p: Sūtras are generally given in abbreviated form by citing the initial akṣaras. The end of the commentary to a sūtra is marked by a double daṇḍa, followed by a small blank space and another double daṇḍa.

item.marginalia: A few short corrections, mostly on the top margin of the folio.

bindingDesc.p: On the inner side of the front cover, the number 72 and the annotation "Cambridge Add.ms. 1657 University Library", in black ink.

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1876.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
